# UD Guarani OldTuDeT

Language: [Guarani](/gn/index.html) (code: `gn`)<br/>
Family: Tupian, Maweti-Guarani

This treebank has been part of Universal Dependencies since the UD v2.10 release.

The following people have contributed to making this treebank part of UD: Fabrício Ferraz Gerardi, Lorena Martín Rodríguez.

Repository: [UD_Guarani-OldTuDeT](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Guarani-OldTuDeT)<br />
Search this treebank on-line: [PML-TQ](https://lindat.mff.cuni.cz/services/pmltq/#!/treebank/udgn_oldtudet213)<br />
Download all treebanks: [UD 2.13](/#download)

License: CC BY-SA 4.0

Genre: grammar-examples

Questions, comments?
General annotation questions (either Guarani-specific or cross-linguistic) can be raised in the [main UD issue tracker](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues).
You can report bugs in this treebank in the [treebank-specific issue tracker on Github](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Guarani-OldTuDeT/issues).
If you want to collaborate, please contact [fabricio&nbsp;•&nbsp;gerardi&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;uni-tuebingen&nbsp;•&nbsp;de].
Development of the treebank happens directly in the UD repository, so you may submit bug fixes as pull requests against the dev branch.

|------------|--------|

| UPOS | annotated manually, natively in UD style |
| XPOS | not available |
| Features | annotated manually, natively in UD style |
| Relations | annotated manually, natively in UD style |

## Description

UD_Guarani-OldTuDeT is a collection of annotated texts in <a href="https://glottolog.org/resource/languoid/id/oldp1258">Old Guaraní</a>. All known sources in this language are being annotated: cathesisms, grammars (seventeenth and eighteenth century), sentences from dictionaries, and other texts. Sentence annotation and documentation by Fabrício Ferraz Gerardi and Lorena Martín Rodríguez.






UD_Guarani-OldTuDeT is a collection of annotated texts in <a href="https://glottolog.org/resource/languoid/id/oldp1258">Old Guaraní</a>. It is part of [TuLaR](https://tular.clld.org), Tupían Language Resources. The project is work in progress and the treebank is being updated on a regular basis. The treebank is work-in-progress and is being updated on a regular basis. Sentence annotation and documentation by Fabrício Ferraz Gerardi and Lorena Martín Rodríguez.



## Text sources

* Restivo, Paulo (1724) Arte de la lengua Guarani por el P. Antonio Ruiz de Montoya de la Compañia de Jesus. Con los escolios anotaciones y apéndices.

* Blas Petronio (1696) Arte de la lengua guarani. Uruguay.

* Montoya, Antonio Ruiz (1876[1640]) Arte de la lengua guarani o mas bien tupi. Nueva edicion. Paris. Maisoneneuve y Cia.

* Montoya, Antonio Ruiz (1876[1640]) Vocabulario y tesoro de la lengua guarani, o mas bien Tupi. Nueva edicion. Paris. Maisoneneuve y Cia.

* Montoya, Antonio Ruiz (1640) Catecismo de la lengua guaraní.


## Acknowledgments

The development of this treebank is supported by the by European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (Grant agreement No. [834050](https://uni-tuebingen.de/fakultaeten/philosophische-fakultaet/fachbereiche/neuphilologie/seminar-fuer-sprachwissenschaft/arbeitsbereiche/allg-sprachwissenschaft/projekte/crosslingference/)).

<h2>Tokenization and Word Segmentation</h2>


<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 59 sentences, 212 tokens and 217 syntactic words.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>All tokens in this corpus are followed by a space.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain words with spaces.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 30 types of words that contain both letters and punctuation. Examples: ra'e, mba'e, ha'e, humava'e, omombe'u, Pa'i, a'e, a'u, akoiva'e, ame'ẽ, apyre'ỹ, araka'e, añemombe'u, chekane'õ, eguĩva'e, ha'eva'e, ha've, ha'épe, hasyva’e, ikaraiva'ekue, imbo'évo, iñangaipava'ekue, kova'e, kuiva'e, mava'e, mbo'eharéra, ndearu'ãmbe'e, oiko'e, pupera'e, py'a</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 5 multi-word tokens. On average, one multi-word token consists of 2.00 syntactic words.</li>
<li>There are 5 types of multi-word tokens. Examples: Avareta, Tupãsy, Tupãópeguarãngue, akóiramo, ojapokuaa.</li>
</ul>

<h2>Morphology</h2>

<h3>Tags</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 11 UPOS tags out of 17 possible: <a>ADP</a>, <a>ADV</a>, <a>DET</a>, <a>INTJ</a>, <a>NOUN</a>, <a>NUM</a>, <a>PART</a>, <a>PRON</a>, <a>PROPN</a>, <a>PUNCT</a>, <a>VERB</a></li>
<li>This corpus does not use the following tags: ADJ, AUX, SCONJ, CCONJ, SYM, X</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 11 word types tagged as particles (PART): ete, meme, nanga, neguĩ, niko, nuguĩ, panga, ra'e, rako, verami, ñote</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 17 lemmas tagged as pronouns (PRON): _, a'u, aipo, akoi, akói, ase, eguĩ, eupe, evokoi, ha'e, ko, kui, ma, nde, opakatu, ukui, ãng</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 3 lemmas tagged as determiners (DET): ha'eva'e, nguĩ, ãng</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Out of the above, 1 lemmas occurred sometimes as PRON and sometimes as DET: ãng</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 0 lemmas tagged as auxiliaries (AUX): </li>
</ul>

<ul>
</ul>

</ul>

<h2>Syntax</h2>

<h3>Auxiliary Verbs and Copula</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain copulas.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain auxiliaries.</li>
</ul>

<h3>Core Arguments, Oblique Arguments and Adjuncts</h3>

Here we consider only relations between verbs (parent) and nouns or pronouns (child).

    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN (1)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>

  <li><a>iobj</a>

  </li>
</ul>




<h3>Relations Overview</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 2 relation subtypes: <a>obl:obj</a>, <a>obl:subj</a></li>
<li>The following 19 relation types are not used in this corpus at all: <a>csubj</a>, <a>ccomp</a>, <a>vocative</a>, <a>expl</a>, <a>dislocated</a>, <a>aux</a>, <a>cop</a>, <a>mark</a>, <a>acl</a>, <a>amod</a>, <a>clf</a>, <a>conj</a>, <a>cc</a>, <a>fixed</a>, <a>flat</a>, <a>list</a>, <a>orphan</a>, <a>goeswith</a>, <a>reparandum</a></li>
</ul>
